description: This trap is used to provide a real time indication
of a critical alarm condition. The variables listed
in VARIABLES clause are defined in `mgmt-info'
group and are present in all critical alarms.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBAlarmCritical COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBSeqNumber i 9999 COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBDateAndTime s EXAMPLEE COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBSeverity i 1 COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBComponentID s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMP COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBNotificationID i 9999 COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBSourceIPAddress s EXAMPLE COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBErrCode s EXAMPLEE COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBAlarmType i 1 COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBProbableCause i 0 COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBAlarmData s EXAMPLE

description: Sequence number of the alarm; starts at 1 and increments by 1;
must be unique for all alarms emited from commonMIB.
variables.name: COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBSeqNumber

description: Time at which the alarm occurred.
variables.name: COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBDateAndTime

description: The severity of the alarm which should indicate the
priority of the event
variables.name: COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBSeverity

description: This variable binding contains colon (:) separated string uniquely
representing the system component that raised this trap. This varbind
is in '<systemName>:<siteName>:<componentName>'format. This is
generated dynamically from traps received from system elements
and for each element it would be unique within system
variables.name: COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBComponentID

description: This variable binding is intended to support clears from system
elements that are capable of providing unique Id for generated
traps and their corresponding clears. If system element does not
provide unique notification id, this value would be set to 0
indicating that system do not support clears.
variables.name: COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBNotificationID

description: The IP address of the element that originated the trap.
variables.name: COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBSourceIPAddress

description: Represents specific error code generated by any system element.
variables.name: COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBErrCode

description: The alarm type field as defined by OSI which is used
to indicate a broad category of what is wrong. The
first 6 values are OSI-defined; refer to CCITT X.733/ISO
10164-4 (for the first 5) and CCITT X.736/ISO 10164-4
(for the last) for a more complete description. The
value 'operator' is used when an alarm is issued due
to an operator command. The values 'debug' and 'unknown'
are for compatibility with older switches and are used
for debugging alarms and for those which do not fit
any of the above, respectively.
variables.name: COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBAlarmType

description: The probable cause for the alarm which usually
qualifies the Alarm Type field. Most values are
OSI-defined; refer to CCITT X.733 and X.736
(ISO 10164-4 and 10164-7) for a more complete
description.
variables.name: COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBProbableCause

description: This variable binding represents textual description
of trap.
variables.name: COMMON-TRAP-MIB::commonMIBAlarmData

of a Major alarm condition. The variables listed
in VARIABLES clause are defined in `mgmt-info'
group and are present in all major alarms.
